Description: Scarab in glazed composition, probably mould-made; underside decorated with hieroglyphic inscription, giving the name of Amun-Ra; surface eroded (according to Gardner drawing).
Curator's comments: Scarab not yet located, published by Gardner (in Gardner 1888, pl. XVIII, no. 39). The inscription on the underside can be compared with a stone scarab published by Petrie, though it needs to be read from right to left (Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVIII, no. 182). This scarab could belong to Gorton's type XXVIII B, a type which was widely distributed in the Mediterranean area and Southern Russia (Gorton 1996, 93, 103-105, type XXVIII B). Gardner, E. A. 1888, Naukratis. Part II (Sixth Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Gorton, A. F. 1996, Egyptian and Egyptianizing scarabs: a typology of steatite, faience, and paste scarabs from Punic and other Mediterranean sites, Oxford. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OC.094) (phase 3)
